place.desc: A region at the southeastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea, encompassing the coastal plain between Phoenicia and Gaza. The region's name derives from the Hebrew Pl≈°th, "the land of the Philistines."
Capital city of the Eastern Roman Empire, the Latin, and the Ottoman Empires founded by Constantine I in AD 330.

place.desc: An ancient city of Cappadocia that was the capital of the Neo-Hittite kingdom in the first millennium B.C.
